param.name: pDesc
param.para: A pointer to a structure that receives the description of the 3D texture.

summary.para: A 3D texture interface represents texel data, which is structured memory.

remarks.para: To create an empty Texture3D resource, call . For info about how to create a 2D texture, which is similar to creating a 3D texture, see How to: Create a Texture.

Textures can't be bound directly to the pipeline; instead, a view must be created and bound. Using a view, texture data can be interpreted at run time within certain restrictions. To use the texture as a render-target or depth-stencil resource, call , and , respectively. To use the texture as an input to a shader, call .
